intro: Dendrocnide milnei, commonly known as the stinging tree, is a flowering plant native to northeastern Australia. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters tall, characterized by its dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. Its leaves are covered in fine, hair-like structures that can cause severe skin irritation upon contact. The plant is part of the Dendrocnide genus, which is known for its toxic properties and defensive adaptations.
